text: Disruption of NF-kappaB or NFAT5 sites in the LTR inhibits MTb - induced HIV-1 replication in MDM .

MDM from four normal donors were infected with 1000 TCID50 of HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - WT or the mutants HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB I-Mut , HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB II-Mut , HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB I+II-Mut , or HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - N5-Mut , and were either ( A ) left infected with virus alone or ( B ) co-infected with MTb CDC1551 ( 1 : 1 MDM : bacilli ) .
Viral <extra_id_0> p24 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in the culture supernatants were measured at days 4 , 7 and 12 post-infection .
Presentation of viral <extra_id_0> p24 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels at day 12 in cultures infected with ( C ) HIV-1 alone or ( D ) co-infected with MTb are shown as histograms .
( * , p < 0.05 ; ** , p < 0.01 , as compared to HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - WT ) .
